00048 #pragma once
00049 #ifndef AI_DEFINES_H_INC
00050 #define AI_DEFINES_H_INC
00051 
00052 #include <assimp/config.h>
00053 
00055     /* Define ASSIMP_BUILD_NO_XX_IMPORTER to disable a specific
00056      * file format loader. The loader is be excluded from the
00057      * build in this case. 'XX' stands for the most common file
00058      * extension of the file format. E.g.:
00059      * ASSIMP_BUILD_NO_X_IMPORTER disables the X loader.
00060      *
00061      * If you're unsure about that, take a look at the implementation of the
00062      * import plugin you wish to disable. You'll find the right define in the
00063      * first lines of the corresponding unit.
00064      *
00065      * Other (mixed) configuration switches are listed here:
00066      *    ASSIMP_BUILD_NO_COMPRESSED_X
00067      *      - Disable support for compressed X files (zip)
00068      *    ASSIMP_BUILD_NO_COMPRESSED_BLEND
00069      *      - Disable support for compressed Blender files (zip)
00070      *    ASSIMP_BUILD_NO_COMPRESSED_IFC
00071      *      - Disable support for IFCZIP files (unzip)
00072      */
00074 
00075 #ifndef ASSIMP_BUILD_NO_COMPRESSED_X
00076 #   define ASSIMP_BUILD_NEED_Z_INFLATE
00077 #endif
00078 
00079 #ifndef ASSIMP_BUILD_NO_COMPRESSED_BLEND
00080 #   define ASSIMP_BUILD_NEED_Z_INFLATE
00081 #endif
00082 
00083 #ifndef ASSIMP_BUILD_NO_COMPRESSED_IFC
00084 #   define ASSIMP_BUILD_NEED_Z_INFLATE
00085 #   define ASSIMP_BUILD_NEED_UNZIP
00086 #endif
00087 
00088 #ifndef ASSIMP_BUILD_NO_Q3BSP_IMPORTER
00089 #   define ASSIMP_BUILD_NEED_Z_INFLATE
00090 #   define ASSIMP_BUILD_NEED_UNZIP
00091 #endif
00092 
00094     /* Define ASSIMP_BUILD_NO_XX_PROCESS to disable a specific
00095      * post processing step. This is the current list of process names ('XX'):
00096      * CALCTANGENTS
00097      * JOINVERTICES
00098      * TRIANGULATE
00099      * GENFACENORMALS
00100      * GENVERTEXNORMALS
00101      * REMOVEVC
00102      * SPLITLARGEMESHES
00103      * PRETRANSFORMVERTICES
00104      * LIMITBONEWEIGHTS
00105      * VALIDATEDS
00106      * IMPROVECACHELOCALITY
00107      * FIXINFACINGNORMALS
00108      * REMOVE_REDUNDANTMATERIALS
00109      * OPTIMIZEGRAPH
00110      * SORTBYPTYPE
00111      * FINDINVALIDDATA
00112      * TRANSFORMTEXCOORDS
00113      * GENUVCOORDS
00114      * ENTITYMESHBUILDER
00115      * MAKELEFTHANDED
00116      * FLIPUVS
00117      * FLIPWINDINGORDER
00118      * OPTIMIZEMESHES
00119      * OPTIMIZEANIMS
00120      * OPTIMIZEGRAPH
00121      * GENENTITYMESHES
00122      * FIXTEXTUREPATHS */
00124 
00125 #ifdef _MSC_VER
00126 #   undef ASSIMP_API
00127 
00129     /* Define 'ASSIMP_BUILD_DLL_EXPORT' to build a DLL of the library */
00131 #   ifdef ASSIMP_BUILD_DLL_EXPORT
00132 #       define ASSIMP_API __declspec(dllexport)
00133 #       define ASSIMP_API_WINONLY __declspec(dllexport)
00134 #       pragma warning (disable : 4251)
00135 
00137     /* Define 'ASSIMP_DLL' before including Assimp to link to ASSIMP in
00138      * an external DLL under Windows. Default is static linkage. */
00140 #   elif (defined ASSIMP_DLL)
00141 #       define ASSIMP_API __declspec(dllimport)
00142 #       define ASSIMP_API_WINONLY __declspec(dllimport)
00143 #   else
00144 #       define ASSIMP_API
00145 #       define ASSIMP_API_WINONLY
00146 #   endif
00147 
00148     /* Force the compiler to inline a function, if possible
00149      */
00150 #   define AI_FORCE_INLINE __forceinline
00151 
00152     /* Tells the compiler that a function never returns. Used in code analysis
00153      * to skip dead paths (e.g. after an assertion evaluated to false). */
00154 #   define AI_WONT_RETURN __declspec(noreturn)
00155 
00156 #elif defined(SWIG)
00157 
00158     /* Do nothing, the relevant defines are all in AssimpSwigPort.i */
00159 
00160 #else
00161 
00162 #   define AI_WONT_RETURN
00163 
00164 #   define ASSIMP_API __attribute__ ((visibility("default")))
00165 #   define ASSIMP_API_WINONLY
00166 #   define AI_FORCE_INLINE inline
00167 #endif // (defined _MSC_VER)
00168 
00169 #ifdef __GNUC__
00170 #   define AI_WONT_RETURN_SUFFIX  __attribute__((noreturn))
00171 #else
00172 #   define AI_WONT_RETURN_SUFFIX
00173 #endif // (defined __clang__)
00174 
00175 #ifdef __cplusplus
00176     /* No explicit 'struct' and 'enum' tags for C++, this keeps showing up
00177      * in doxydocs.
00178      */
00179 #   define C_STRUCT
00180 #   define C_ENUM
00181 #else
00183     /* To build the documentation, make sure ASSIMP_DOXYGEN_BUILD
00184      * is defined by Doxygen's preprocessor. The corresponding
00185      * entries in the DOXYFILE are: */
00187 #if 0
00188     ENABLE_PREPROCESSING   = YES
00189     MACRO_EXPANSION        = YES
00190     EXPAND_ONLY_PREDEF     = YES
00191     SEARCH_INCLUDES        = YES
00192     INCLUDE_PATH           =
00193     INCLUDE_FILE_PATTERNS  =
00194     PREDEFINED             = ASSIMP_DOXYGEN_BUILD=1
00195     EXPAND_AS_DEFINED      = C_STRUCT C_ENUM
00196     SKIP_FUNCTION_MACROS   = YES
00197 #endif
00199     /* Doxygen gets confused if we use c-struct typedefs to avoid
00200      * the explicit 'struct' notation. This trick here has the same
00201      * effect as the TYPEDEF_HIDES_STRUCT option, but we don't need
00202      * to typedef all structs/enums. */
00204 #   if (defined ASSIMP_DOXYGEN_BUILD)
00205 #       define C_STRUCT
00206 #       define C_ENUM
00207 #   else
00208 #       define C_STRUCT struct
00209 #       define C_ENUM   enum
00210 #   endif
00211 #endif

00214 #error Currently, Borland is unsupported. Feel free to port Assimp.

00218 #endif

00222     /* Define ASSIMP_BUILD_SINGLETHREADED to compile assimp
00223      * without threading support. The library doesn't utilize
00224      * threads then and is itself not threadsafe. */
00226 #ifndef ASSIMP_BUILD_SINGLETHREADED
00227 #   define ASSIMP_BUILD_SINGLETHREADED
00228 #endif
00229 
00230 #if defined(_DEBUG) || ! defined(NDEBUG)
00231 #   define ASSIMP_BUILD_DEBUG
00232 #endif
00233 
00235     /* Define ASSIMP_DOUBLE_PRECISION to compile assimp
00236      * with double precision support (64-bit). */
00238 
00239 #ifdef ASSIMP_DOUBLE_PRECISION
00240     typedef double ai_real;
00241     typedef signed long long int ai_int;
00242     typedef unsigned long long int ai_uint;
00243 #else // ASSIMP_DOUBLE_PRECISION
00244     typedef float ai_real;
00245     typedef signed int ai_int;
00246     typedef unsigned int ai_uint;
00247 #endif // ASSIMP_DOUBLE_PRECISION
00248 
00250     /* Useful constants */
00252 
00253 /* This is PI. Hi PI. */
00254 #define AI_MATH_PI          (3.141592653589793238462643383279 )
00255 #define AI_MATH_TWO_PI      (AI_MATH_PI * 2.0)
00256 #define AI_MATH_HALF_PI     (AI_MATH_PI * 0.5)
00257 
00258 /* And this is to avoid endless casts to float */
00259 #define AI_MATH_PI_F        (3.1415926538f)
00260 #define AI_MATH_TWO_PI_F    (AI_MATH_PI_F * 2.0f)
00261 #define AI_MATH_HALF_PI_F   (AI_MATH_PI_F * 0.5f)
00262 
00263 /* Tiny macro to convert from radians to degrees and back */
00264 #define AI_DEG_TO_RAD(x) ((x)*(ai_real)0.0174532925)
00265 #define AI_RAD_TO_DEG(x) ((x)*(ai_real)57.2957795)
00266 
00267 /* Support for big-endian builds */
00268 #if defined(__BYTE_ORDER__)
00269 #   if (__BYTE_ORDER__ == __ORDER_BIG_ENDIAN__)
00270 #       if !defined(__BIG_ENDIAN__)
00271 #           define __BIG_ENDIAN__
00272 #       endif
00273 #   else /* little endian */
00274 #       if defined (__BIG_ENDIAN__)
00275 #           undef __BIG_ENDIAN__
00276 #       endif
00277 #   endif
00278 #endif
00279 #if defined(__BIG_ENDIAN__)
00280 #   define AI_BUILD_BIG_ENDIAN
00281 #endif

00284 /* To avoid running out of memory
00285  * This can be adjusted for specific use cases
00286  * It's NOT a total limit, just a limit for individual allocations
00287  */
00288 #define AI_MAX_ALLOC(type) ((256U * 1024 * 1024) / sizeof(type))
